title: 114_hr4302
content: Termination of bank functions. The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating functions transferred from the Bank as outlined in the Act. All functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations of the Bank and others have been satisfied. The Secretary must report to Congress when this determination is made. The Secretary will report to Congress when determining the termination of functions transferred from the Bank as outlined in the Act. SEC. 8. DUTIES OF THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, handling outstanding obligations of the Federal Government from terminated programs, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. They may also delegate functions to wind up and dissolve transferred functions. The Secretary may take necessary actions to wind up and dissolve functions transferred under the Act, without authorizing positions and functions of the Bank after 60 days of abolishment. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS AND REPEALS. Repeal of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions from other Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts such as the Bank Export Services Act and the Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions, including sections from various Acts such as the Bank Export Services Act and the Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, are repealed. Additionally, specific sections from the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, and title 31 of the United States Code are also amended. Amendment to various sections of title 5 and title 31 of the United States Code, including the elimination of positions at level iii and iv. Elimination of positions at level iv in the Export-Import Bank of Washington and the Office of Inspector General for the Bank is amended to remove references to the Bank. The text chunk amends paragraphs in relation to the Export-Import Bank, specifies the effective date of the repeals and amendments, and requires the Secretary to submit a report to Congress on necessary amendments to Federal statutes. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive orders, rules, regulations, or documents pertaining to a department or office from which a function is transferred by this Act is deemed to refer to the department or office to which the function is transferred. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. The term "function" includes duties, powers, activities, or programs. The term "office" includes any administrative entity or component.
